definitions.definition: to invent or make something, such as a speech or a device, at the time when it is needed without already having planned it:
examples: I hadn't prepared a speech so I suddenly had to improvise.

definitions.definition: When actors or musicians improvise, they perform without prepared speech or music, making up the play, music, etc. as they perform it:
examples: During certain scenes of the play there isn't any script and the actors just improvise (the dialogue).
